channel.title: Whalesbook Financial News
channel.description: Latest Indian and global financial market news

item.title: India's Legal Fog: Indemnity Uncertainty Stifles Investment
item.description: India's commercial contracts are navigating significant uncertainty in indemnity clauses, where judicial interpretations diverge sharply from the narrow scope of the Indian Contract Act, 1872. This legal opacity inflates transaction costs, complicates negotiations, and undermines investor confidence, acting as a substantial impediment to the nation's economic growth and global competitiveness. The current state of affairs demands urgent clarification to align legal practice with modern commerce and attract vital foreign investment.

item.title: Kranti Industries Sees Strong Sales Growth, Turns Profitable with Defence Orders
item.description: Kranti Industries Limited has reported a strong performance for Q3 and 9M FY26, showcasing significant year-on-year growth in revenue and profitability. The company turned PAT positive for both periods, driven by improved margins and strategic entry into defence manufacturing, including new orders worth ₹20.45 Cr. Operations at its new Plant 4 have also commenced, boosting capacity.

item.title: India Accelerates Trade Pacts Amid Growth Concerns
item.description: India is aggressively pursuing an interim trade agreement with the U.S., sending a senior delegation to finalize legal aspects and targeting 18% tariff cuts this week. This move is part of a broader strategy to diversify trade relationships, including FTAs with the UK, Chile, and Canada, to meet ambitious export targets amid moderating global demand.

item.title: AU Real Estate's Rs 1500 Cr Luxury Gamble in Ghaziabad
item.description: AU Real Estate has announced a substantial Rs 1,500 crore investment to develop 'The Sunflower,' a 9-acre luxury housing project in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh. The company anticipates Rs 2,000 crore in revenue from the development, which features 595 apartments with prices starting at Rs 3 crore. This move signals an aggressive expansion strategy into the competitive Delhi-NCR luxury real estate market.

item.title: MOA Nets $1B+ India Fund Amid Global Capital Surge
item.description: Motilal Oswal Alternate's India Business Excellence Fund V closed at Rs 8,500 crore, its largest ever, attracting significant foreign capital for growth investments in consumer, healthcare, financial services, and manufacturing. This marks a substantial influx of global LP interest in India's expanding private markets, yet signals heightened competition and potential valuation pressures in its target sectors. The fund's success contrasts with a broader industry trend of declining overall fundraising despite rising deal activity.

item.title: IndoStar Capital Finance Sees 20% Disbursement Jump, But Profit Dips
item.description: IndoStar Capital Finance posted a 20% rise in disbursements to ₹1,117 crore in Q3 FY26 compared to the previous quarter, driven by its vehicle finance arm. However, net profit saw a dip to ₹8.3 crore from ₹10.5 crore in Q2 FY26. The company continues its strategic shift towards retail-led growth, focusing on used vehicles and Micro LAP, while exiting affordable housing.

item.title: Analyst Picks: Growth Prospects Weighed Against Sector Headwinds
item.description: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified ten Indian companies poised for growth following a strong Q3 FY26 performance across many sectors. While these companies benefit from strong domestic demand, government support, and strategic expansions, investors must consider significant sector-specific challenges, competitive pressures, and elevated valuations that could temper near-term expectations. The report analyzes specific risks for each stock, offering a balanced view beyond the initial bullish recommendations.

item.title: GE Power India: Core Services Surge, But Overall Orders Plummet 59%
item.description: GE Power India reported a significant turnaround in its third quarter, with profits soaring due to operational improvements and one-off settlements. However, the company's overall order intake saw a drastic 59% year-on-year decline. While core services orders showed robust growth, the sharp drop in total orders, coupled with a peculiar order booking anomaly, raises concerns about future revenue streams.

item.title: JSW MG Bets on Scaled Chinese EV Tech to Capture India's Nascent Market
item.description: JSW MG Motor India is embarking on an aggressive expansion, investing approximately ₹4,000 crore to scale its Halol plant capacity to 300,000 units and introduce four new vehicles, including NEVs and a plug-in hybrid. This strategy hinges on leveraging its parent SAIC Motor's advanced, scaled New Energy Vehicle technology to navigate India's rapidly developing EV market. The move aims to solidify its position against dominant players like Tata Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra, who are also making substantial EV investments.

item.title: Oriental Aromatics Slips Into Loss Despite Revenue Rise; Mahad Plant Troubles Emerge
item.description: Oriental Aromatics Limited has reported a net loss of ₹1.92 crore for the third quarter ended December 31, 2025, a stark reversal from a profit of ₹7.14 crore in the same period last year. Despite a 13% year-on-year revenue growth to ₹252.03 crore, the company's EBITDA margin compressed significantly to 5.26% from over 10% in the previous year, driven by operational drags from its new Mahad facility and ongoing pricing pressures. For the nine-month period, the company also reported a net loss of ₹0.67 crore versus a profit of ₹32.90 crore earlier.

item.title: Inditrade Auditors Quit Citing Data Gaps; Investor Trust at Stake
item.description: Inditrade Capital Limited's statutory auditors, Kirtane & Pandit LLP, have resigned citing the company's failure to provide complete and timely financial information. This serious governance concern means auditors couldn't perform their duties, impacting investor confidence. The company has appointed new auditors, but questions remain about financial transparency.

item.title: Orchid Pharma Sales Drop, Margins Plummet Amid Market Woes
item.description: Orchid Pharma reported a challenging third quarter for FY26, with sales falling 5% year-on-year to ₹207 crore and EBITDA margins shrinking sharply to 6% from 17% in the prior year. The company cited continued stress in the global antibiotics market, depressed pricing, and geopolitical impacts as key reasons. For the nine months ended FY26, sales declined 16% to ₹574 crore, with EBITDA at ₹58 crore and margins at 10%. Despite these headwinds, management sees 'green shoots' and is focused on strategic initiatives like Exblifex commercialization and the 7ACA project, viewing FY26 as a transition year.

item.title: Kranti Industries Q3 Profit Surges 3X, Defence Orders Boost Growth
item.description: Kranti Industries reported a strong Q3 FY26, with revenue soaring 32.2% year-on-year to ₹2,286.8 lakh and EBITDA multiplying by three times to ₹354.6 lakh. The company achieved a significant profit of ₹73.7 lakh, marking a return to profitability after previous losses. Key drivers include robust demand in the auto component sector, the successful entry into defence manufacturing with new orders worth over ₹200 lakh, and the commencement of operations at its new Plant 4.

item.title: Puravankara Surges: Profit Roars Back, Income Spikes 230% on Strong Sales
item.description: Puravankara Limited has reported a dramatic turnaround in its Q3 FY'26 results, with total income soaring 230% year-on-year to ₹1,104 Crore. The company swung to a Profit After Tax (PAT) of ₹58 Crore, a significant jump from a ₹94 Crore loss in the same period last year. This performance was driven by strong presales growth of 17% and record quarterly collections of ₹1,140 Crore, supported by operational efficiencies and cost controls that boosted EBITDA margins to 23%. The company also highlighted a robust pipeline of new project launches and significant business development additions, positioning it for continued growth.

item.title: Privi Speciality Chemicals Posts Strong Q3 Growth, Unveils Ambitious Expansion Plan
item.description: Privi Speciality Chemicals announced stellar Q3 FY26 results, with revenue up 25% YoY to ₹611 Cr and PAT growing by ~86%. The company unveiled a 3-phase expansion plan to boost capacity by 55% and set a long-term vision for ₹5,000 Cr revenue, signaling strong growth ahead.

item.title: Company Posts 553% PAT Jump on Improved Operations
item.description: A company has reported strong financial results for the third quarter of fiscal year 2026. Profit After Tax (PAT) soared by 553.9% year-on-year to ₹5.0 Crore, driven by a significant improvement in EBITDA margins to 9.9% and increased capacity utilization reaching 67%. Management expects continued growth, dependent on geopolitical stability.

item.title: Renaissance Global Surges on Strong D2C Growth, Eyes Margin Boost
item.description: Renaissance Global posted strong Q3 FY'26 results with 16% YoY revenue growth, driven by its US Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) business which surged 50%. The company is transforming into a brand-led, consumer-centric jewellery platform, aiming for double-digit EBITDA margins and improved ROE/ROCE. While working capital remains a focus, management is optimistic about future profitability and expansion plans for its luxury brand, Jean Dousset.

item.title: eMudhra Bags Key Africa Digital Identity Certification
item.description: eMudhra has secured MOSIP certification, significantly enhancing its capacity to support large-scale digital public infrastructure and digital identity programs, particularly across Africa. This accreditation positions the company as a key partner for African nations developing secure and legally recognized digital systems.

item.title: India-US Formalize Trade Deal: Tariffs, Cotton at Core
item.description: India and the United States are progressing towards formalizing their recent trade understanding into a legally binding agreement, with chief negotiator Darpan Jain's visit to the US next week aiming to push talks to closure. A March 2026 signing is targeted, though not finalized. Central to discussions are tariff reductions, with India seeking to lower US tariffs from 25% to 18% to enhance export market access. Cotton trade specifics, including varieties and market terms for India's $250 million annual import, are also prominent. This effort signifies a critical step in solidifying the bilateral trade architecture.

item.title: India REITs Distribute Record ₹2,450 Cr, Regulatory Shifts Loom
item.description: India's five listed Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) collectively distributed over ₹2,450 crore to more than 3.8 lakh unitholders in Q3 FY26. This highlights the sector's increasing financial market role, managing over 185 million sq ft of Grade A space. With AUM surpassing ₹2,50,000 crore, the market is expanding. Upcoming regulatory changes, including direct bank lending and CPSE asset monetization, are poised to reshape the investment landscape, while performance metrics show a divergence among listed entities.

item.title: NHAI's Raajmarg IPO: Infrastructure Funding Push Meets Market Scrutiny
item.description: Raajmarg Infra Investment Trust, sponsored by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI), is preparing to launch an initial public offering in early March, aiming to raise as much as ₹57 billion ($629 million) to fund infrastructure projects. The offering will allocate 75% to institutional investors and 25% to non-institutional ones. This move comes as NHAI successfully reduces its debt, signaling a strategic shift towards market-based financing for national infrastructure.

item.title: India's MSP Outlay Soars, But Farmer Grievances Persist
item.description: India's government allocated a record ₹3.47 lakh crore for Minimum Support Price (MSP) procurement in 2024-25, a significant increase from previous years. This expanded outlay led to higher volumes and benefited an estimated 19.6 million farmers, representing about 14% of farming households. Despite this quantitative growth, widespread farmer protests continue, rooted in demands for a legal MSP guarantee and the adoption of a more comprehensive cost calculation formula.

item.title: Leading Leasing Plans ₹235 Cr Share Issue to Convert Loans
item.description: Leading Leasing Finance and Investment Company Limited's board has approved a significant preferential issuance of equity shares worth approximately ₹235.06 crore. This move aims to convert unsecured loans into equity, increasing the company's authorized share capital from ₹60 crore to ₹115 crore. Shareholders will vote on the proposal at an Extra-Ordinary General Meeting scheduled for March 18, 2026.

item.title: Varvee Global Debt-Free, Turns Profitable on Non-Denim Fabric Shift
item.description: Varvee Global Limited, formerly Aarvee Denims, has completed a dramatic financial turnaround, becoming debt-free and achieving a significant return to profitability in Q3 FY26. The company's strategic pivot towards value-added non-denim fabrics, coupled with new management and capacity expansion, has driven substantial revenue growth and margin improvement, signaling a new growth phase. India Ratings has assigned a positive outlook.

item.title: JSW Infrastructure Board to Meet Feb 20 for Funding Plan
item.description: JSW Infrastructure Limited has called a board meeting for February 20, 2026, to explore raising funds through the issuance of equity shares. This move signals potential expansion plans. The company has also restricted trading for its employees and key personnel from immediate effect until February 22, 2026, ahead of the announcement.

item.title: Veerhealth Care Surges on US FDA Nod, Eyes ₹100 Cr Revenue.
item.description: Veerhealth Care Limited has reported a strong third quarter for FY26, with total income jumping 73.13% year-on-year to ₹6.96 Crore. The company also achieved significant EBITDA growth of 181.44%. A major highlight is the US FDA clearance for drug exports, opening up international markets. Management forecasts ambitious growth, aiming for ₹45-50 Crore revenue in FY27 and ₹100 Crore within two years.

item.title: Girnar Spintex Revenue Soars, But Q3 Loss Widens Sharply
item.description: Girnar Spintex Industries reported a 27.77% year-on-year revenue jump to ₹3,074.60 Crores in Q3 FY26. However, the company's net loss widened significantly to ₹343.38 Crores, compared to a loss of ₹124.77 Crores in the prior year. While losses improved sequentially, the overall profitability remains a major concern for investors.

item.title: Cochin Shipyard Wins ₹5,000 Crore Navy Order as Lowest Bidder
item.description: Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) has emerged as the lowest bidder (L1) for a significant tender floated by the Ministry of Defence. The company is set to build five Next Generation Survey Vessels (NGSV) for the Indian Navy, with the estimated order value standing at approximately ₹5,000 crore. This development marks a substantial boost to CSL's order book and reinforces its role in India's defense shipbuilding capabilities.

item.title: Girnar Spintex Turns Profitable YoY, But QoQ Slump & 9M Decline Raise Questions
item.description: Girnar Spintex Industries has reported a turnaround, posting a net profit of ₹5.76 Cr in Q3 FY26 compared to a loss last year. However, profits fell 54.2% sequentially, and nine-month profits are down 24.4% YoY, raising concerns about sustainability despite strong revenue growth.

item.title: Mankind Pharma's AI Supply Chain Boosts Efficiency, Faces Valuation Scrutiny
item.description: Mankind Pharma has finalized an extensive, multi-year supply chain and procurement transformation in partnership with Accenture. The initiative, leveraging advanced analytics and AI, has significantly reduced drug stock-outs by 75% and optimized inventory by up to 20%. Despite these operational achievements, the company faces valuation challenges, with a P/E ratio higher than sector peers and mixed analyst sentiment suggesting a complex outlook.

item.title: Sahyadri Industries Q3 Profit Jumps 550%, Margins Surge on Higher Sales
item.description: Sahyadri Industries Limited reported a robust Q3 FY26, with net profit soaring 553.9% year-on-year to ₹5.0 Cr. EBITDA grew 60.1% to ₹14.4 Cr, driven by a 10.8% revenue increase and improved capacity utilization, pushing EBITDA margins to 9.9%. The company also reduced its net debt. Future growth is planned through significant capital expenditure on new manufacturing units.

item.title: Nurture Well Surges on Strong Q3, Eyes ₹2500 Cr Revenue by FY29
item.description: Nurture Well Industries reported a robust Q3 FY26, with revenue up 45.80% year-on-year to ₹289.77 Cr and net profit surging 95.04% to ₹34.60 Cr. The company unveiled ambitious growth plans, including new product launches and a new manufacturing unit, targeting ₹2,500 Cr revenue by FY29 and improved EBITDA margins.

item.title: Glottis Ltd Profit Plummets 80% Amid Global Trade Slowdown
item.description: Glottis Ltd reported a challenging third quarter for FY26, with revenue down 27.2% year-on-year to ₹143.9 Crore. Profit After Tax (PAT) saw a steep 79.9% decline to ₹2.7 Crore, and EBITDA margins contracted significantly to 2.8%, driven by softer global trade and pressure on freight rates.

item.title: Happy Forgings Hits Record Highs in Revenue and Profit
item.description: Happy Forgings Limited has posted its strongest quarter yet, with Q3 FY26 revenue climbing 10.4% year-on-year to ₹391 crore and profit after tax surging 22.3% to ₹79 crore. The company is aggressively expanding its manufacturing capacity and aims to significantly boost export revenue from FY27, despite facing some global market headwinds and raw material price volatility.

item.title: Ipca Labs Profit Surges 31% on Tax Benefits, But Revenue Dips Amid Margin Gains
item.description: Ipca Laboratories reported a strong Q3 FY26 with consolidated net profit soaring 31% year-on-year to ₹326.27 crore. This was boosted by improved margins and a lower tax rate. However, the company saw a sequential decline in revenue by 6.42% to ₹2,392.50 crore, prompting analysts to scrutinize the sustainability of its earnings growth. Standalone performance also showed robust profit growth with improved margins.

item.title: Alkem Labs Q3 Profit Grows 1.6% Amidst Bold MedTech Acquisition
item.description: Alkem Laboratories reported a 10.7% year-on-year revenue increase to ₹3,736.8 crore for Q3 FY26, with international sales showing strong 26.6% growth. Net profit grew a modest 1.6% to ₹636 crore, impacted by an exceptional item related to labour codes. The company announced a strategic move into the MedTech sector by acquiring a 55% majority stake in Swiss firm Occlutech for approximately ₹1,074 crore. This diversification aims to tap into the growing medical device market, with Occlutech projected to generate significant revenue in the coming years. However, Alkem faces a potential delay in its Denosumab biosimilar launch due to ongoing litigation with Amgen.

item.title: Education Firm Posts Q3 Loss, Revenue Shifted, But Eyes Growth Via Acquisition
item.description: An education company reported a Q3 FY26 loss of ₹28.7 crore and shifted revenue to Q4, citing syllabus revisions. However, it completed the acquisition of CPD Singapore to boost international curriculum offerings and maintained strong FY26 revenue and margin guidance. Improved working capital metrics were also noted.

item.title: Rane Holdings Posts Net Loss Despite Revenue Surge on JV Provision
item.description: Rane Holdings Limited reported a consolidated net loss of ₹39.5 crore for the third quarter of FY26, significantly impacted by its share of an ₹84.63 crore warranty provision from a joint venture entity (ZF Rane Automotive) related to a product recall. Despite this, the company saw robust revenue growth of 23.6% year-on-year to ₹1,539.3 crore and a 39.5% jump in EBITDA. Key subsidiaries Rane (Madras) and Rane Steering Systems secured substantial new orders.

item.title: Civic Financial Tech Sees Revenue Surge 50% in Q3 on Strong Orders
item.description: Civic Financial Technologies reported stellar Q3 FY26 results with revenue jumping 49.9% year-on-year to ₹31.25 Cr. Profit after tax (PAT) surged by 118.3% to ₹2.27 Cr on a standalone basis. The company highlighted robust order wins totalling ₹128 Cr for the nine-month period and a confirmed order book of ₹242 Cr, bolstered by a strong pipeline. A strategic focus on AI and platform leadership is driving growth.

item.title: Sportking India Profit Jumps 33% on Sales, Eyes ₹1000 Cr Odisha Expansion
item.description: Sportking India's Q3 FY'26 net profit soared 33% year-on-year to ₹24.6 Cr, driven by revenue growth and improved operational efficiencies. The company unveiled ambitious plans, including a ₹1000 Cr greenfield project in Odisha and garment business mergers, anticipating benefits from the EU-India FTA and improved US trade ties.
